title: Module Reflection: Values & Purpose
description: Look back on what you discovered about your values and purpose. Rate how your purpose statement feels, notice what shifted, and set an intention for carrying this forward.

steps.title: Pause and Look Back
steps.content: You've done real work this module — sorting your values, reframing your goals, and drafting a purpose statement. Before you move on, let's take a moment to see how far you've come. Reflection isn't extra credit. It's where the learning actually sticks.

steps.title: Why Reflection Matters
steps.content: Research in psychology shows that reflection deepens learning more than additional practice alone. When you pause to notice what you've experienced, your brain encodes it differently — it moves from short-term awareness to lasting insight. In ACT, this is called 'contacting the present moment.' You're not analyzing yourself — you're just noticing what's here. This module asked you to explore your values, question your goals, and name your purpose. That's a lot. Giving yourself a few minutes to digest it is what turns an exercise into a real shift.
steps.keyTakeaway: Reflection turns experiences into lasting insights by helping your brain process what you've learned.

steps.title: Rate Your Purpose Statement
steps.content: Think about the purpose statement you drafted in the last lesson. Read it again (or recall it as best you can). Then rate how it feels across a few dimensions. There are no right answers — this is just useful data about where you are.
steps.exercisePrompt: Rate each dimension from 1 (not at all) to 10 (completely).

exerciseItems.label: Clarity
exerciseItems.description: How clear and understandable is your purpose statement?

exerciseItems.label: Resonance
exerciseItems.description: How deeply does it resonate with who you are right now?

exerciseItems.label: Motivation
exerciseItems.description: How motivated does it make you feel when you read it?

exerciseItems.label: Authenticity
exerciseItems.description: How honest and true to yourself does it feel?

steps.title: What Shifted This Module?
steps.content: Think back across all four lessons. Something may have surprised you, challenged you, or quietly clicked into place.

reflectPrompts.prompt: What was your biggest insight or aha moment from this module?
How much clearer do you feel about your personal values compared to before?
Is there anything from this module you want to revisit or go deeper on?

steps.title: Carry Your Values Forward
steps.content: Knowing your values is powerful, but only if you let them guide your choices. Pick one way to keep your values visible this week.
steps.commitPrompt: This week, I'll stay connected to my values by...
commitOptions: Reviewing my purpose statement at the start of each day
Making one decision this week by asking 'does this align with my values?'
Journaling for two minutes each evening about how I lived my values today
